creditline: Gift of Henry White Cannon, Jr., Class of 1910, in memory of his Father

texts.textentryhtml: Marchese Lodovico Canossa (?-?), Verona; Purchased by Jean Paul Richter (1847-1937) in Verona in June 1911 for Henry White Cannon (1850-1934), Fiesole; by descent to his son, Henry (Harry) W. Cannon, Jr. (1887-1966), Class of 1910; Donated to the Museum in 1935.

bibliography.boilertext: Jean Paul Richter, A descriptive catalogue of old masters of the Italian school, (Florence: Galileiana, 1907-1914).
bibliography.citation: Jean Paul Richter, A descriptive catalogue of old masters of the Italian school, (Florence: Galileiana, 1907-1914)., Part II: no. 45; p. 37-38

bibliography.boilertext: Jean Paul Richter, The Cannon Collection of italian paintings of the Renaissance: mostly of the Veronese School..., (Princeton, NJ: Princetion University Press, 1936).
bibliography.citation: Jean Paul Richter, The Cannon Collection of italian paintings of the Renaissance: mostly of the Veronese School..., (Princeton, NJ: Princetion University Press, 1936)., no. 25; o, 32-33; fig. 25

bibliography.citation: Diana Gisolfi, "The School of Verona in American collections", Artibus et Historiae 17, no. 34 (1996): p. 177-191., p. 187, fig. 10; p. 187-88

bibliography.boilertext: Bartolomeo dal Pozzo, Le vite de’ pittori, degli scvltori, et architetti veronesi, raccolte da varj autori stampati, e manuscritti, e da altre particolari memorie: con la narratiua delle pitture, e sculture, che s’attrouano nelle chiese, case, & altri luoghi publici, e priuati di Verona, e suo territorio, (Verona: 1718).
